cause.description:
Our Scientific Advisory Committee sits twice a year to evaluate project proposals from some of the world's top scientists. After intense scrutiny we then award grants to those projects that meet our strict criteria. This ensures that AICR funds only research of the highest quality. In 2009 we began funding over 53 new projects worldwide. Our aim in 2010 is to increase this number.
If you are able to assist us in supporting cancer research projects by making a donation, however large or small, please donate here: http://www.aicr.org.uk/donate.aspx
Association for International Cancer Research Madras House South Street St Andrews KY16 9EH
Registered in Scotland, No 152991. Charity No. SC022918
1. We currently have more than 214 projects underway.
2. We have no geographical boundaries - we fund the best science, no matter where it takes place
3. With 2 funding rounds per year, we can react quickly to new developments
4. We do not employ scientists nor run labs. By not being encumbered by financial overheads we can maximise the funds going towards cancer research
5. If you would like to donate http://www.aicr.org.uk/donate.aspx
